steps.title: Acknowledge Your Feelings
steps.voiceCue: Take a deep breath. It's okay to feel whatever you're feeling about your recovery. Acknowledge these emotions without judgment.

steps.title: Set a Positive Intention
steps.voiceCue: Now, let's gently shift your focus. Picture a small, achievable step you can take today towards healing. Hold onto this positive intention.

steps.title: Deep Breathing
steps.voiceCue: Sit comfortably with good posture. Inhale slowly through your nose, feeling your belly rise, then exhale completely through your mouth. Repeat for a calming effect.

steps.title: Left Hand Finger Stretches
steps.voiceCue: Using your unaffected left hand, gently spread your fingers wide, then make a loose fist. Repeat slowly, focusing on each movement.

steps.title: Shoulder Shrugs (Both Sides)
steps.voiceCue: Gently lift both shoulders towards your ears, then slowly lower them down. Feel the tension release. Keep your right wrist stable and supported.

steps.title: Right Arm Visualization
steps.voiceCue: Close your eyes if comfortable. Visualize your right arm and wrist feeling strong and healthy. Imagine healthy blood flow and gentle healing energy.

steps.title: Focus on Sensation (Non-Injured Areas)
steps.voiceCue: Lie down or sit comfortably. Bring your awareness to your feet, then your legs, slowly moving up your body. Notice sensations without judgment, bypassing the injured area.

steps.title: Gentle Awareness of Right Arm
steps.voiceCue: Now, gently bring a soft awareness to your right arm, without dwelling on pain. Just notice its presence and imagine it being comforted and supported.

steps.title: Reflect on Day 1
steps.voiceCue: Think about yesterday's session. Even completing the routine is a victory! Acknowledge your commitment and effort.

steps.title: Visualize Your Progress
steps.voiceCue: Close your eyes and imagine your right wrist growing stronger, piece by piece. See yourself comfortably performing daily tasks. This positive vision fuels your recovery.

steps.title: Left Wrist Circles (Gentle)
steps.voiceCue: Gently make small circles with your left wrist, first clockwise then counter-clockwise. Focus on smooth, pain-free movement.

steps.title: Scapular Squeezes
steps.voiceCue: Sit or stand tall. Gently squeeze your shoulder blades together as if holding a pencil between them. Hold for a few seconds, then release. Keep your right arm relaxed and supported.

steps.title: Gentle Right Elbow Flexion/Extension
steps.voiceCue: Support your right forearm with your left hand or on a pillow. Slowly bend and straighten your right elbow, keeping your wrist in a neutral, stable position. Only move within a pain-free range.

steps.title: Torso Twists (Seated)
steps.voiceCue: Sit comfortably. Gently twist your upper body to the left, then to the right, keeping your hips stable. Use your core, not your arms, for this movement.

steps.title: Identify 3 Things You're Grateful For
steps.voiceCue: Take a moment to reflect. What are three things, big or small, you are grateful for today? Let these feelings of appreciation wash over you.

steps.title: Focus on Inner Strength
steps.voiceCue: Feel grateful for your body's ability to heal and your own inner strength to persevere through this recovery journey.

steps.title: Acknowledge Challenges and Strengths
steps.voiceCue: Recovery has its ups and downs. Acknowledge any challenges you've faced, and remember the strength you've shown in facing them.

steps.title: Affirm Your Commitment
steps.voiceCue: You are committed to your healing. Gently tell yourself, 'I am taking care of my body, and I am healing.' This affirmation reinforces your path to full recovery.

steps.title: Gentle Neck Rolls
steps.voiceCue: Slowly and gently roll your head from side to side, bringing your ear towards your shoulder. Avoid full circles initially. Feel the gentle stretch in your neck.

steps.title: Right Arm Pendulum Swings (Supported)
steps.voiceCue: Lean forward, supporting your non-injured arm on a table. Let your right arm hang freely. Gently allow gravity to create small, pain-free swings forward and backward, then side to side. Keep the wrist still.

steps.title: Left Hand Finger Opposition
steps.voiceCue: With your left hand, gently touch your thumb to each fingertip, one by one. This helps maintain dexterity and coordination.

steps.title: Full Body Relaxation Scan
steps.voiceCue: Lie down comfortably. Systematically tense and then relax different muscle groups throughout your body, from your toes to your head, excluding your right wrist. Enjoy the feeling of release.

steps.title: Identify Next Small Steps
steps.voiceCue: Think about what you'd like to achieve in your recovery this coming week. Set one or two small, realistic goals for your continued healing.

steps.title: Plan for Rest and Self-Care
steps.voiceCue: Remember that rest is a crucial part of recovery. Plan a time for intentional relaxation and self-care in your upcoming week. Your body needs it.
